results.title: Music for the movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
Aaron Copland, famed American composer-pianist, narrates and conducts his own film musical scores. Copland has chosen music from “Red Pony”, “Our Town” and “Something Wild” as a framework in which to show the purpose and meaning of background scores for motion pictures. Featuring the New York Philharmonic.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.

Featuring the New York Philharmonic.

results.title: A Birthday tribute to Shostakovich
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and C B S Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
To celebrate the birthday of a famous Russian composer, Shostakovich, the New York Philharmonic under Leonard Bernstein plays part of the former’s Symphony No 7 (the Leningrad Symphony). This is followed by all of Symphony No 9. Bernstein also gives a sound illustrated lesson in musical theory.

results.title: Twenty-Eight Up: Prog.1: Pt.1&2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Twenty eight up continues the World in action series, following the development and changing attitudes of a group of British children every seven years, they are now twenty eight. This program talks to Tony, Bruce and Suzi.

results.title: Seven up
results.creator_credit: Paul Almond, Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “World in action”.
Life viewed by Britain’s seven year olds. They give their views on life, leisure, love, marriage, colour prejudice, education, money and their ambitions for the future.

results.title: 7 plus seven
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Fourteen children from a variety of school backgrounds, interviewed in 1964 for television about their hopes and aspirations, are followed up seven years later. Extracts from the first program, made when the children were seven years old, are shown and the children comment on any changes in their ideas.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
